pageContext.claim: “And we have a great -- as your Attorney General just said, the case [for the National Emergency] is a very strong case, a very powerful case.”
pageContext.analysis: It's a real legal question whether Trump can circumvent Congress's power under the Constitution to approve or reject spending by declaring a national emergency to fund his promised border wall. Many legal scholars and lawmakers say he can't, including conservatives. Trump routinely argues that immigrants bring more crime, but researchers have found continually that legal and unauthorized immigrants commit crime at lower rates than the native-born population.
